tweet.analyzer.core

Class TweetAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tweet.analyzer.core.TweetAnalyzer

  • public class TweetAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    Principal class of the Tweet Analyzer project contains all methods that may be invoked by external applications
    Author:
    TvPad

      • relevantWords

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> relevantWords(Tweet t,
                                                              KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                              double threshold)
        Returns all the relevant words in a tweet, uses the specified relevancy threshold
        Parameters:
        t - a tweet
        kb - the reference knowledge based (needed to get IDF)
        threshold - relevancy threshold
        Returns:
        a list of the word that have a weight higher than the relevancy threshold

      • relevantWords

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> relevantWords(Tweet t,
                                                              KnowledgeBase kb)
        Returns all the relevant words in a tweet. Uses the default relevancy threshold defined in WORD_RELEVANCY_THRESHOLD
        Parameters:
        t - a tweet
        kb - the reference knowledge based (needed to get IDF)
        Returns:
        a list of the words that have a weight higher than the default relevancy threshold

      • weightedWordsFromATweetSet

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> weightedWordsFromATweetSet(java.util.List<Tweet> tset,
                                                                           KnowledgeBase kb)
        Extracts all the words from a set of tweets and computes their weight (tf*IDF)
        Parameters:
        tset - A set of tweets
        kb - The reference knowledge base (to compute IDF)
        Returns:
        all the Words from the set weighted and ordered by decreasing weight

      • relevantWordsFromATweetSet

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> relevantWordsFromATweetSet(java.util.List<Tweet> tset,
                                                                           KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                                           double threshold)
        Returns all the relevant words in a set of tweets
        Parameters:
        tset - a set of Tweets
        kb - the reference knownledge base used to compute IDF
        threshold - the relevancy threshold
        Returns:
        all the words with weight greater than the relevancy threshold sorted by weight (descending order)

      • relevantWordsFromATweetSet

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> relevantWordsFromATweetSet(java.util.List<Tweet> tset,
                                                                           KnowledgeBase kb)
        Returns all the relevant words in a set of tweets. Uses the default value as relevancy threshold
        Parameters:
        tset - a set of Tweets
        kb - the reference knownledge base used to compute IDF
        Returns:
        all the words with weight greater than the relevancy threshold sorted by weight (descending order)

      • computeRelevantWords

        public static void computeRelevantWords(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                        KnowledgeBase kb,
                                        java.lang.Double threshold)
        Computes relevant words for every tweet in the list. The field of the object tweet is valorized
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - a list of tweet
        kb - the reference knowledge base
        threshold - the relevancy threshold

      • computeRelevantWords

        public static void computeRelevantWords(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                        KnowledgeBase kb)
        Computes relevant words for every tweet in the list. The field of the object tweet is valorized. The default relevancy threshold is used.
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - a list of tweet
        kb - the reference knowledge base

      • topmostWordsFromATweetSet

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> topmostWordsFromATweetSet(java.util.List<Tweet> tset,
                                                                          KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                                          int k)
        Most relevant words in a tweetset
        Parameters:
        tset - a set of tweets
        kb - he reference knowledge base (to obtain IDF)
        k - number of most relevant words to extract from the corpus (higher tf*IDF)
        Returns:
        the k most relevant words in the list/corpus ordererd by relevancy

      • topmostWordsFromATweetSetNoKeywords

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> topmostWordsFromATweetSetNoKeywords(java.util.List<Tweet> tset,
                                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> keywords,
                                                                                    KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                                                    int k)
        Most relevant words in a tweetset, keywords excluded
        Parameters:
        tset - a set of tweets
        keywords - list of keywords to exclude
        kb - he reference knowledge base (to obtain IDF)
        k - number of most relevant words to extract from the corpus (higher tf*IDF)
        Returns:
        the k most relevant words in the list/corpus ordererd by relevancy

      • topmost

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> topmost(java.lang.String words,
                                                        KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                        int k)
        Most relevant words in a list
        Parameters:
        words - string containing a list of words separated by spaces
        kb - the reference knowledge base (to obtain IDF)
        k - number of most relevant words to extract from the corpus (higher tf*IDF)
        Returns:
        the k most relevant words in the tweetset sorted by relevancy

      • containingRelevantWord

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> containingRelevantWord(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                           java.lang.String relevantWord)
        Returns all the tweet from a list that contain the specified relevant word (the field relevantWords of the tweets in the list has to be set!)
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - the list of tweet
        relevantWord - the string representing the relevant word to search for
        Returns:
        the tweets from the input list containing the specified relevant word

      • containingRelevantWords

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> containingRelevantWords(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                            java.lang.String[] relevantWords)
        Returns all the tweet from a list that contain at least one of the specified relevant words (the field relevantWords of the tweets in the list has to be set!)
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - the list of tweets
        relevantWords - A string array representing the relevant words to search for
        Returns:
        the list of tweet containing at least one of the specified relevant words

      • countWords

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> countWords(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> wordlist)
        Return the count of occurrences of a set of words in a set of tweets
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - the set of tweets
        wordlist - the set of words to be counted in the tweetset (as a list of strings)
        Returns:
        an HashMap having a string (word) as key, and the word count in the tweetset as value

      • countWordsSorted

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WordCount> countWordsSorted(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> wordlist)
        Return the count of occurrences of a set of words in a set of tweets
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - the set of tweets
        wordlist - the set of words to be counted in the tweetset (as a list of strings)
        Returns:
        an Set of WordCount, sorted by number of occurrences

      • filterTweetsFromList

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> filterTweetsFromList(java.util.List<Tweet> inputlist,
                                                         java.util.List<Subject> subjects,
                                                         java.lang.String[] relevantWords)
        Filters a list of tweets by subjects and relevant words (Warning: relevant words must be computed before invoking this method!)
        Parameters:
        inputlist - the list of tweets to filter
        subjects - subjects to search for (set null for no filtering on subjects)
        relevantWords - relevant words to search for (set null for no filtering on relevant words)
        Returns:
        the filtered list of tweets

      • wordClusterer

        public static java.util.List<Cluster> wordClusterer(java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> wordset,
                                                    KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                    java.lang.Integer nclust)
        Executes clustering on a set of words
        Parameters:
        wordset - the set of words to clusterize
        kb - the reference knowledge based from which derive word vectorial representation
        nclust - the number of cluster (K-means)
        Returns:
        the list of clusters

      • tweetClusterer

        public static java.util.List<Cluster> tweetClusterer(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                     KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                     java.lang.Integer nclust)
        Executes clustering on a set of tweets. Considers only relevant words using default relevancy threshold
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - the list of tweet containing words to be clustered
        kb - the reference knowledge based from which derive word vectorial representation
        nclust - the number of cluster (K-means)
        Returns:
        the list of clusters

      • tweetClusterer

        public static java.util.List<Cluster> tweetClusterer(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                     KnowledgeBase kb,
                                                     java.lang.Integer nclust,
                                                     double threshold)
        Executes clustering on a set of tweets. Considers only relevant words using the input relevancy threshold
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - the list of tweet containing words to be clustered
        kb - the reference knowledge based from which derive word vectorial representation
        nclust - the number of cluster (K-means)
        threshold - relevancy threshold
        Returns:
        the list of clusters

      • wordClustererUpdate

        public static java.util.List<Cluster> wordClustererUpdate(java.util.List<Cluster> oldclusters,
                                                          java.util.SortedSet<WeightedWord> wordset,
                                                          KnowledgeBase kb)
        Update clusters adding the words in input to current clusters
        Parameters:
        oldclusters - existing clusters
        wordset - new words to cluster
        kb - the reference knowledge based from which derive word vectorial representation
        Returns:
        list of updated clusters

      • tweetClustererUpdate

        public static java.util.List<Cluster> tweetClustererUpdate(java.util.List<Cluster> oldclusters,
                                                           java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                           KnowledgeBase kb)
        Update Clusters adding relevant words from a list of tweets to current clusters
        Parameters:
        oldclusters - existing clusters
        tweetlist - list of tweet to cluster
        kb - the reference knowledge based from which derive word vectorial representation
        Returns:
        list of updated clusters

      • selectTweetsForSubject

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> selectTweetsForSubject(java.util.List<Tweet> tlist,
                                                           Subject s)
        Selects all the tweets from a list that contain the specified subject
        Parameters:
        tlist - a list of tweets
        s - the subject (in all its surface forms)
        Returns:
        the tweet that contains at least one of the forms of the subject (the comparison is case insensitive)

      • selectTweetsForSubjects

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> selectTweetsForSubjects(java.util.List<Tweet> tlist,
                                                            java.util.List<Subject> slist)
        Selects all the tweets from a list that contains at least one of the specified subjects
        Parameters:
        tlist - the tweet list
        slist - the subject list
        Returns:
        a list of tweets containing the specified subjects

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        array of Sentiment (SentimentName, Value)

      • getSentimentForSubject

                                                 Subject s)
        Returns the sentiment of a list of tweets filtered by subject
        Parameters:
        tlist - the list of tweets
        s - the subject
        Returns:
        an array of Sentiment (SentimentName, Value)

      • setSentiment

        public static void setSentiment(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> positiveWords,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> insultingWords)
        Set the sentiment attribute for all the tweets in a list
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - a list of tweet
        positiveWords - the list of positive words
        insultingWords - the list of insulting words

      • filterTweetsBySentiment

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> filterTweetsBySentiment(java.util.List<Tweet> tweetlist,
                                                            java.lang.String sentiment)
        Filters tweets by sentiment (Warning: sentiment must be computed before invoking this method!)
        Parameters:
        tweetlist - a list of tweet
        sentiment - a string, allowed values ={"POSITIVE", "INSULTING", "WITHLINKS"}
        Returns:
        the tweets in the original list filtered by sentiment

      • sequenceForSubjects

        public static java.util.List<WeightedString> sequenceForSubjects(java.lang.String input,
                                                                 java.util.List<Subject> subjects,
                                                                 java.lang.String[] tagSequence,
                                                                 POS pos,
                                                                 Tokenizer tknz,
                                                                 KnowledgeBase KB,
                                                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> stopwords)
        Finds sequences in the input string containing the pos tag sequence and the subjects specified
        Parameters:
        input - input string
        subjects - list of subjects to search for
        tagSequence - sequence of tags to search for; ex: ["N","V"] or ["R","G"]
        pos - a pos tagger object to execute pos-tagging
        tknz - a tokenizer object to tokenize the input string
        KB - the reference knowledge base
        stopwords - the list of stopwords to exclude
        Returns:
        all the sequences from input string containing the specified pos-tags sequence and subjects

      • sequenceForSubjects

        public static java.util.List<WeightedString> sequenceForSubjects(Tweet inputTweet,
                                                                 java.util.List<Subject> subjects,
                                                                 java.lang.String[] tagSequence,
                                                                 POS pos,
                                                                 Tokenizer tknz,
                                                                 KnowledgeBase KB,
                                                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> stopwords)
        Extracts pos-sequences from a tweet.
        Parameters:
        inputTweet - the input tweet
        subjects - list of subjects to search for
        tagSequence - sequence of tags to search for; ex: ["N","V"] or ["R","G"]
        pos - a pos tagger object to execute pos-tagging
        tknz - a tokenizer object to tokenize the input string
        KB - the reference knowledge base
        stopwords - the list of stopwords to exclude
        Returns:
        all the sequences from the input tweet containing the specified pos-tags sequence and subjects

      • sequenceForSubjects

        public static java.util.SortedSet<WeightedString> sequenceForSubjects(java.util.List<Tweet> tlist,
                                                                      java.util.List<Subject> subjects,
                                                                      java.lang.String[] tagSequence,
                                                                      POS pos,
                                                                      Tokenizer tknz,
                                                                      KnowledgeBase KB,
                                                                      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> stopwords)
        Extracts pos-sequences from a list of tweets. Results are ordered by relevancy
        Parameters:
        tlist - the input tweet list
        subjects - list of subjects to search for
        tagSequence - sequence of tags to search for; ex: ["N","V"] or ["R","G"]
        pos - a pos tagger object to execute pos-tagging
        tknz - a tokenizer object to tokenize the input string
        KB - the reference knowledge base
        stopwords - the list of stopwords to exclude
        Returns:
        all the sequences from the input tweets containing the specified pos-tags sequence and subjects sorted by relevancy (descending)
